text:
(bright music)
- My name is Joe Clark.
I work for Domo as a software architect.

At Domo, we work with, you
know, a lot of customers
that really care about their data

and they're trying to get
insights from their data.

And one thing that generative
AI has been able to provide

is a way for us to communicate
with our data systems
in a really natural way.

And so being able to
provide that capability
through our product to our customers
has been really exciting,

and we hope really impactful
to our customers as well.

You know, one of the things
that we really care about

at Domo is security of
the underlying data.
And that's, you know, as we all know,
good AI really starts with good data.

We really care about providing
that governance layer
that allows administrators to make it easy
for users to access their data
and be able to leverage that with AI,

be able to ask questions
using generative AI

about that data without
exposing those users to data
that they shouldn't have access to.
With AWS Bedrock, because we have access
to not only best-in-class models,
but also models from multiple providers,

we've been able to, you
know, test our services
using a bunch of different models
and pick the best model for the use case
that we're trying to build on top of,
and that lets us move faster
in delivering value to our customers.
Of course, when customers think about AI,

the first thing they
think about is, you know,
how secure is my data?

Where is my data going?
How is it being used?

And Amazon Bedrock really
helps us solve that concern
for our customers because we know that,

A, that the data doesn't
leave our hosting environment,

and B, the host providers
don't have access to that data,
so they can't see it,
you know, they can't train on it.
And that's been really helpful for us
in these conversations with our customers.

AWS helps Domo be more
innovative by providing us
with the underlying services that we need,
especially right now with generative AI,

the underlying models that
we need without needing,

you know, the massive
infrastructure investment

that comes with some of
these large language models.
(bright music continues)
